Critical Evaluation

User Experience

We constantly considered HCI design principles when we were implementing this project.
We ensure our users have good user experience by:
1.Everytime users make an action such as deleting an appointment,we tell him whether the action is successful or not using notification messages. 2.When users provides invaild data while filling a form, there is a clear message notifing them the problem. 3.Our key functionalities are very visible in our user interface. 4.Our user interfaces are responsive and components are designed to fit in mobile screens.

Functionality

We implemented our project according to the moscow list. However we narrowed down the scope due to the time constraints.
There are certain functionalities that are more challenging to implement such as automatically arrange free slots between each appointments in order to allows ocularists to rest.
These features are not necessarily vital to our website so we decide to focus more on the other key fundamental functionalities.
Our requirements changed and refined every time we have meeting with our clients and we agreed that requirement 14 and 17 were no longer desired by our clients. We managed to achieve most required functionalities : a neat timetable for both single ocularist and a teams, a easy and intuitive appointment booking system and a logical access to relative informations.
Our core principle is to provide ocularists and admins easy workflow managed. To achieve that,we:
1. Allow users to book in appointments from both free slots in my timetable and appointment page.
2.Allow users to view relative informations from both my timetable and patient / appointment page.
For requirement"Changes should able to be record and check changes history of the appointments", we later find out that all changes will be recorded in the PAS system and it is more convenient for our client to access Statistics from PAS directly.
We tick this functionalities as completed although it is not through our work.

Stability-Efficiency

Compatibility

We deploy our website using docker and linode. This ensured high Compatibility of our project. Docker allows easy deployment by setting up container enviroment and allow web to be run in different hosts.

Maintainability

We refactored every single code lines we wrote to make sure it is good practice.
We also documented our methods so that our code is highly readable.
Thanks to Django framework our website uses model-control-view pattern and features are implemented seperatly. We made sure our code base is clear and understandable so that Further maintains could be easier.

Project management

Overall, we had good project management skills. We allocated different tasks to each members according to their skill sets and had regular communications using zoom and telegram. We meet up with clients and TAs once a week and took meeting minutes for refence. We managed our time and set deadlins using gantt chart.

Further work

1. We can make availale slots presented as drop down list when booking an appointment.
2.Our filter function allow users to search for appointments and patients. More intuitivly we could instead use check boxes for filter types such as 'Priority', which could be confusing to asking users to type in.
3.
